Jordan Lee

Developer, Engineer, Scientist

Just a nice dude who likes to code and learn. Its pretty neat.

Just a bit about me

Well, it all started when I was a kid. My Playstation 2 wouldn't function so I was upset. I couldn't afford to replace it, so I had to take matters into my own hands. I disassembled the console, learned the design of the hardware, and reassembled it. what I learned, was that I love technology, and if I keep pushing myself to learn, I can accomplish what I need to do. Pretty soon, I was fixing my friend's consoles and later it blossomed into building my own computers and learning to code.

Knowledge has been my pursuit in life. Being a single Dad, I needed to prove to my kids that education can expand the opportunites to seize life-long memories. I did this by obtaining my Bachelors of Science, majoring in Computer Science.

Person-Centered Coding

Finally, a dude that cares about the end-user. Modern design is not just about the look, but also the functionality and practicality of it's surrounding environment. The end product should visually be appealing and be so usable that even a caveman could use it (Give me a time machine, I'll prove it!).

Tools of the Trade

  • Next.js

  • C#

  • GitHub

The Pursuit of Knowledge

Being the life-long learner that I am, learning doesn't just stop at college. Although I have my bachelors degree, I am always looking for new ways to expand my knowledge. I am currently learning about Game Development using the Phaser 3 Framework. I also just so happen to be looking to start my Masters program in Computer Science in the near future.

Bachelor's of Science, Computer Science

  • Weber State University, Utah
  • Graduated 2023

Expert in Management and Communication

One of the benefits of working with me is that I have an extensive background in management. This translates to effective communication and enable me to get the job done. I have worked with some of the most difficult situations in the healthcare industry that have taught me to be an expert in critical thinking and rapid problem solving. This experience will serve me in the tech field as I work with my team. Because of these skills, I aim to achieve the position of CTO in the future.
